sanskrit_verse:
गवा चान्नमुपघ्रातं घुष्टान्नं च विशेषतः ।
गणान्नं गणिकान्नं च विदुषा च जुगुप्सितम् ॥ ४.२०९॥
transliteration:
gavā cānnamupaghātaṃ ghuṣṭānnaṃ ca viśeṣataḥ |
gaṇānnaṃ gaṇikānnaṃ ca viduṣā ca jugupsitam || 4.209||
sph_interpretive_translation: Food obtained from cows, food contaminated by impure contact, food from outcasts, and food from courtesans—these are declared repugnant by the wise.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of discernment lies in alignment with purity-consciousness
Causation arises from the source of sustenance and its energetic integrity
Capacity-based responsibility includes mindful selection and consumption
Restoration logic demands purification of intake channels for consciousness elevation
Consciousness alignment requires rejection of substances that degrade spiritual substratum
executable_legal_axioms: IF a substance originates from a degraded or impure source THEN it shall not be accepted as lawful nourishment
IF ingestion occurs through contamination OR association with degraded conduct THEN automatic purification protocol initiates
IF individual consumes prohibited nourishment THEN capacity restoration through pranayama and mantra-based detoxification activates
IF collective nourishment system allows degraded inputs THEN systemic realignment protocol executes immediately
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning public health, dietary regulations, and societal well-being, the threshold of responsibility lies in maintaining purity at all levels of consumption. The court must ensure that no entity permits degradation in sustenance pathways, aligning authority with dharma-preserving action rather than punitive oversight.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana establishes that degraded nourishment disrupts consciousness flow. Anupurvasah shows how impure intake leads to diminished capacity. Proportional responsibility rests on awareness, not intent. Non-punitive reality rule affirms correction through purification, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Agnihotra-based sanctification of affected spaces
Assign mantra-repetition and breath-cleansing practices to restore inner purity
Realign individual's relationship with nourishment through conscious sourcing protocols
Establish community-wide purification rituals to neutralize collective exposure
final_declaration: Declared by SPH as Source: This law restores Dharma by purifying intake paths. Reality remains non-punitive; consciousness alone adjudicates truth. All beings return to purity when nourishment aligns with divinity.
